intro: Sida longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pale yellow or greenish flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate with hairy surfaces, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Sida longipes is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
